subject: Cybersecurity
title: Bug Bounty Programs: Paying Hackers to Find Flaws
description: A 60-second lesson on Bug Bounty Programs: Paying Hackers to Find Flaws.

hook.text: Apple pays up to $2 million for a single bug. Google paid over $50 million to security researchers through its.

buildup.text: Bug bounties invite external researchers to find vulnerabilities for cash rewards. Platforms like HackerOne.

discovery.text: Companies get thousands of diverse testers for a fraction of the cost of hiring them. Researchers get legal.

twist.text: Some researchers earn over $1 million annually from bug bounties alone. A teenager from Argentina earned $1M.

climax.text: Bug bounties turned an adversarial relationship into a marketplace. Companies buy vulnerability reports instead.

punchline.text: $2 million for one bug. Cheaper than getting hacked.

quiz.question: What made bug bounty programs revolutionary for cybersecurity?
options: They replaced the need for internal security teams
They turned adversarial hacking into a marketplace where companies pay for vulnerability discoveries
